references.paper_title: Lossless abstraction of imperfect information games
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of lossless abstraction, a fundamental technique used in simplifying imperfect information games, which is crucial for the development of efficient algorithms in this field.

references.paper_title: Potential-aware automated abstraction of sequential games, and holistic equilibrium analysis of Texas Hold’em poker
references.reason: This paper presents an advanced automated abstraction method, considering the potential of each state to guide the abstraction process, thereby improving the accuracy and efficiency of game-solving algorithms.

references.paper_title: Potential-aware imperfect-recall abstraction with earth mover’s distance in imperfect-information games
references.reason: This paper introduces the use of earth mover’s distance (EMD) for hand classification, which is a key technique used in the proposed KrwEmd algorithm to efficiently integrate historical information.

references.paper_title: Expanding the resolution boundary of outcome-based imperfect-recall abstraction in games with ordered signals
references.reason: This paper presents the latest research on imperfect recall abstraction, providing a basis for the comparison of the new K-recall winrate abstraction algorithm with the previous state-of-the-art methods.

references.paper_title: Abstraction methods for game theoretic poker
references.reason: This paper provides some of the earliest work on abstraction techniques specifically applied to poker games, laying the foundation for subsequent research in this area.
